sentence: The infographic is from the ACLU of California, titled "Think Outside the Box."
sentence_cn: 该信息图来自加州美国公民自由联盟，标题为“跳出框框思考”。

sentence: It highlights disparities in spending between education and incarceration.
sentence_cn: 它凸显了教育和监禁之间的支出差异。

sentence: - $10.7 Billion: Amount spent on California's criminal justice budget, 11% of the general fund.
sentence_cn: - 107 亿美元：加州刑事司法预算支出，占普通基金的 11%。

sentence: - 25%: Proportion of the world's prisoners in the U.S.
sentence_cn: - 25%：美国囚犯占世界囚犯的比例。

sentence: - $8,908: Amount CA spends annually on each K-12 student.
sentence_cn: - 8,908 美元：CA 每年在每名 K-12 学生身上花费的金额。

sentence: - $50,000: Amount CA spends annually on each adult in prison.
sentence_cn: - 50,000 美元：加州每年在每个监狱成年人身上花费的金额。

sentence: - 71,000: People in CA county jails, with 50,000 awaiting trial.
sentence_cn: - 71,000：加州监狱中关押的人员中，有 50,000 人等待审判。

sentence: - Costs: $50,000/year for each adult in state prison, $25,000/year in county jail.
sentence_cn: - 费用：州监狱每名成年人每年 50,000 美元，县监狱每名成年人每年 25,000 美元。

sentence: - CCs: 1 year costs for 12,500 full-time community college students.

sentence: - CSU: 1 year tuition for 7 full-time and 1 half-time Cal State students.

sentence: - Encourages visiting www.ThinkOutsidetheBoxCA.org to fix the system.
sentence_cn: - 鼓励访问 www.ThinkOutsidetheBoxCA.org 来修复系统。

sentence: - Includes social media information for engagement.

sentence: The graphic contrasts the high financial cost of incarceration with potential higher education funding, urging a reconsideration of budget priorities.
sentence_cn: 该图表将监禁的高昂财务成本与潜在的高等教育资金进行了对比，呼吁重新考虑预算优先事项。
